channel.title: DDos anyone?
channel.description:
As some of you may know, especially if you frequent IRC, we have been getting inbound spikes of traffic up to 100mbit over the last few days, but especially today. Luckily the new program I set up and configured seems to be handling it quite well:
[img]http://img573.imageshack.us/img573/2062/ddos1.png[/img]
Notice all the bans in the last 30 minutes, crazy. It's also interesting to note that most of those IP's whois show they are dedicated servers, probably exploited.

item.title: DDos anyone?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

When did that happen Rixx?

Read full topic

02[17:17] * Quits: mepholic (wat@4B2B827.5C4D1498.8B9B664B.IP) (Ping timeout) 02[17:17] * Quits: _R3KoN (chingchang@B470E485.25F4DCEC.3D4D93A5.IP) (Ping timeout) ... ... To be continued...[/size]

Well that was the madness caused I think. There’s still more, but I went over the 20000 character limit. Disregard that, the IRC is now running, but with less DDoS!

item.title: DDos anyone?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:372019”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=468078.msg3422396#msg3422396 date=1291606949]
is psad easy to configure? looks pretty useful
[/quote]

Very easy, in fact, it’s a walk in the park. I found out about it here:

simplehelp.net

How to block DDOS attacks in Linux

We ran an article on How to block an IP address in iptables in Linux a few days ago. Here's a complimentary article that shows you how to detect the IP addresses of attackers in case of a a denial of

And basically followed that, except for the whole ‘run this script and make a config file the script can read’ stuff. Then I tweaked the configuration a little to make it ban with iptables and it was off and running.[/quote]do you mind posting your config

Read full topic

item.title: DDos anyone?

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

abraham2119:

is psad easy to configure? looks pretty useful

Very easy, in fact, it’s a walk in the park. I found out about it here:

simplehelp.net

How to block DDOS attacks in Linux

We ran an article on How to block an IP address in iptables in Linux a few days ago. Here's a complimentary article that shows you how to detect the IP addresses of attackers in case of a a denial of

And basically followed that, except for the whole ‘run this script and make a config file the script can read’ stuff. Then I tweaked the configuration a little to make it ban with iptables and it was off and running.

item.title: DDos anyone?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

As some of you may know, especially if you frequent IRC, we have been getting inbound spikes of traffic up to 100mbit over the last few days, but especially today. Luckily the new program I set up and configured seems to be handling it quite well:

Notice all the bans in the last 30 minutes, crazy. It’s also interesting to note that most of those IP’s whois show they are dedicated servers, probably exploited.

Read full topic
